reviewText:
Probably the contendor for most unoriginal game of 2015.

As you have already noticed 'The Undying Plague' is a top down shooter in which you fend of waves of zombies by killing them  with a variety of weapons.

Zombies drop either ammo or money, which you can spend on new weapons, although in my opinion some of the more expensive weapons are worse than the original guns.
You are also able to upgrade your skills 'attributes'; Strength (not sure what that does), Vitality, Toughness, Stamina & Swiftness. Each time you die you keep your attributes but lose the weapons.

The graphics look like a standard flash game, the sound is annoying & the music is OK but doesn't fit the game but these things wouldn't really matter that much to me if the game is fun to play, which it isn't.

The Undying Plague is as repetitive as it can get. The only thing you do is walk around and shoot the chasing zombies, which sounds like an easy task but then there are these other Big" zombies which sometimes get stuck to a wall or stuck on each other and then suddenly storm at you
date: which kills you in 1 hit. As far as I know these are the only 2 types of enemies you encounter in this game but who knows you might encounter something else in wave 342.\n\nBack in the day you would find these games for free on New Grounds or Kongregate and this would be a fine game if you found it there for free but I simply do not think it's worth the money here on Steam."

reviewText:
Usually waves of foes are easy at first and as you play it gets harder; this one isn't made like that. You actually have to be lvl5-6 to pass easy the first waves and live. No wonder why it got bad reviews. Most people died at wave 3- I think [boss fight] and then evacuation procedure plan follows: quit->uninstall->Hide in library->Never speak of it again.

---info---
No health regeneration, no health kits just ammo drops and $ to buy upgrades.
It doesn't support full screen
It doesn't support options menu
It doesn't support sound mute
It does support Trading Cards ..hooray!

Although it has some good features, they're overwhelmed by the bad ones.

...
-edit-19Apr; It appears that there are health kits drops afterall. (thanks @Yorick)

reviewText:
The Undying Plague doesn't do anything that hasn't been done better by about a thousand free flash games.

A short summary of the problems:

-Repetitive gameplay.  Just walk backwards and fire.
-Hit detection.  Hitting close targets is very difficult.  In addition there's little way to tell you are damaging an enemy you can't kill in one hit.
-The game is dark and there are no brightness settings.
-The sprite work is ugly.
-The music is out of place.  It sounds like some free public domain music just thrown into the game.
-Generic-looking HUD
-There's no visual way to tell if you are taking damage unless you are closely looking at the health meter in the corner.

Still, it's better than Zombie Zoeds.

reviewText: It's so bland. The art looks like it was made by a programmer. The music is ambient and almost non-existant, sounds are so quiet and irrelevant. That said it cost about as much as a small burg. I didn't really expect more than that.

reviewText:
Pass on this one. Top-down zombie horde shooters have been done much better elsewhere.

-No settings/options. What kind of game doesn't even let you turn down the volume?
-Character moves much too slowly. Includes a limited sprint function, but it's like placing a BandAid on a disembowlment.
-Somehow, despite the slow movement, the controls are still floaty.
-Invisible walls in the corners of the square arena.
-Mouse not nearly sensitive enough, especially on menus.
-Character doesn't rotate body at the same rate as your mouse movement. Whole thing feels sluggish.
-Pressing Escape immediately takes you back to the main menu without prompt. Be careful not to accidentally hit it.
-Ugly and bland graphics.

Do not spend money on this. Go play a free flash game. Any of them. 80% chance it will be more fun than The Undying Plague.
voteText: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Running backwards simulator 2015. trip/10


Ok, so its not perfect. But its alot of fun to play. I don't know why people have a hard time playing it without freezing or crashing, personally I have never had a problem with that.

The only problem I have had with the game is when I get to level 13 for some reason the infected keep spawning without the wave ending, as if there were still a big zombie still alive (when theres a zombie alive the infected keep spawning slowly).     (PLZ FIX)


The things I think could be added are:

>9000 more weapons (this is something I say for all the games I play, there always needs to be more weapons nuff' said).

Volume control. Sometimes I want to play this game and talk to firends at the same time, but I dont have a way to turn down the volume. :(                   (Plz fix)

More charictars to play as.

Grenades (duh).

Some kind of primary/secondary weapon system.

When I press escape it ends the game. This is bad because other games use escape to open menus. I don't have a problem with TAB being the upgrade menu but I think there should be a secondary menu that opens when you press escape. Like volume conrol, keybindings, settings, stuff like that.


Oh and the soundtrack is cool. (but it could use some more tracks in it). :)


Overall I give it a 7/10 and a 8/10 if they keep working at it.


:)

reviewText: It's a small game made by 2 creative amateurs. TUP is a score shooter that reminds me some retro games that I like it when I was a child. The history of this game is interesting because it started as fan-made game Rojo vs Zombies" for popular Polish youtuber - Rojov13. He decide to run RojoFanGames program where people can share their fan-arts. Some are good
date: some are bad.\n\nIn The Undying Plague the goal is to survive hordes of pixelated zombies as long as possible
recommended: there are some grinding possibilites because each frag will gives you some money and experience to expand your inventory and abilities.\n\nI would recommend TUP to guys who like indie games
hoursPlayed: who want to support creations made by young people. It's not overpriced so why not spending 2 euros to support devs?\n"

voteText: 28 of 56 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This a fun little game thats got as about as much play time as a flash game from 2007. However for the price its actually pretty enjoyable. the leveling system helps make the game more enjoyable. I would definetly pick this up if you want a game to kill and hour or 2 with. Again nothing very fancy but certainly playable and fun.

**-------- UPDATE 4/12/15 --------------**
After takeing a few days to play this game more and invest a bit more time into it. I stick by my guns saying its fun for the price. But it's more than that. This game really brought me back to the simpler times when developers released top down shooters with simple objectives instead of large FPS style games with arching story lines and Final Fantasy like cutscenes.

This game is a prime example of what a simple idea can achieve. Let this be a lesson to all future game devs out there. A simple idea that has been properly executed is 100X better than a grand massive idea that has been hastily put together.
